channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-166] [hbase] Region server hang on exit
item.description:
Observed a region server hung in exit in Hudson-Patch build #637 and managed to get a thread dump. Subsequent comments will include analysis of same.

[junit] Full thread dump Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (1.5.0_11-b03 mixed mode):

[junit] "IPC Client connection to localhost/127.0.0.1:40856" daemon prio=10 tid=0x08cdd8f0 nid=0xaca in Object.wait() [0xe2853000..0xe2853bb8]

[junit] - waiting on <0xf7629730> (a org.apache.hadoop.ipc.Client$Connection)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Console log for the test that failed.

Patch should stop region server from hanging even it it doesn't stop the NPEs

+1

http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12364745/HADOOP-1805-patch.txt applied and successfully tested against trunk revision r570633.

Test results: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/643/testReport/
Console output: http://lucene.zones.apache.org:8080/hudson/job/Hadoop-Patch/643/console

The reason that the region server hung on exit was due to the NPEs encountered when creating a HMemcacheScanner.

The constructor takes out a read lock on the memcache, and normally this lock is released by close, or if an IOException happens in the constructor, the lock is also released. However, the NPE ocurred after taking out the read lock and no runtime exceptions were caught, so by the end of the test run, there was one read lock outstanding for every attempt to construct a scanner that resulted in an NPE.

The cache flusher then acquired the cacheFlusher lock and tried to obtain a write lock on the memcache and blocked.

The cleanup code for the region server tries to acquire the cacheFlusher lock before interrupting the cache flusher thread. This is done so that the thread can exit in a clean state. However, in this case, since the cache flusher held the lock and was blocked, this in turn blocked the region server clean up code and the region server hung.

The solution for this problem is to catch run time exceptions in the HMemcache scanner constructor and ensure that the read lock is released.
Committed patch that fixes region server hang on exit caused by NPE in HMemcacheScanner constructor. Still need to determine the source of the NPEs, but that is HADOOP-1797
